posts.name: Yash Aggarwal
posts.cooked:
Hello everyone! The Signal team is releasing a new version of Signal Desktop, v7.47.0-beta.1. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta here.

Release notes:

  • Now you can expand your local video preview during a call to get a better look at yourself or reflect on who you are.

Commit changes: Comparing v7.46.0-beta.1…v7.47.0-beta.1 · signalapp/Signal-Desktop · GitHub

Thanks for being a beta tester!

New Version: 7.47.0-beta.1

36 new commits since 7.46.0-beta.1:

Show commits

  • v7.47.0-alpha.1 [1]

  • Show a modal for macOS media permissions [2]

  • Fix media permissions modal string [3]

  • Avoid spurious error log when waiting for contact syncs [4]

  • Show update UI on asar changes on Linux [5]

  • Stories: Be resilient to a missing conversation [6]

  • Ensure that call events don't override existing activeCallState [7]

  • Revert "Bump libsignal-client to 0.67.1" [8]

  • Fix zoom on macOS and when restoring window [9]

  • Show speaking indicator in 1:1 calls [10]

  • Calling/handleOutgoingSignaling: Wait for job completion or timeout [11]

  • Reuse webp emoji sheets in the app [12]

  • Move react-dev-tools-core to dev dependencies (#9902) [13]

  • Exclude bundled dependencies from asar [14]

  • Allow leading @ in Compose/Find by username [15]

  • New option: Disable automatic attachment downloads [16]

  • Fix path for resumable downloads [17]

  • Compactify locales even more [18]

  • Fix linking QR code for windows high contrast mode [19]

  • sendNormalMessage: If no errors, still retry messages send if needed [20]

  • Import/export avatar colors [21]

  • Return early in handleIncomingCall if call is ended [22]

  • Show critical-idle-primary-device banner in response to WS upgrade response headers [23]

  • Release notes for 7.46 [24]

  • Update strings [25]

  • Update DNS fallback [26]

  • Use node_linker=hoisted in npmrc to fix electron-builder with pnpm [27]

  • Handle server alerts received on libsignal auth socket [28]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.50.2 [29]

  • Ensure that stories download on view [30]

  • Fix getNextAttachmentDownloadJobs query [31]

  • Calling: New option to expand your local preview [32]

  • Fix file save dialog default path for Linux KDE [33]

  • Release notes for 7.47 [34]

  • Update strings [35]

  • 7.47.0-beta.1 [36]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Desktop v7.46.0-beta.1…v7.47.0-beta.1

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
I’m seeing this weirdness

image998×1079 33.7 KB

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.47.0-beta.1/b42ca21b2a54d8ac0f26b9bf76d10b441d5d381ef7f315139e461e43bc21381c.gz

posts.name: Yash Aggarwal
posts.cooked: @Whatnoww thank you for the report. If you restart the application, does it persist?

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: It goes away when I resize the Window

It is me again, complaining about the startup speed: When I put my computer into sleep mode and it wakes up, I can see Signal immediately. The messages arrive drop by drop. I can already interact with the application. Wouldn’t it be nice if this was the behaviour when doing a normal startup? I don’t want to wait until some messages from yesterday arrive, which takes ten minutes sometimes (I have a gigabit connection).

I am not sure, but wasn’t it like that before? I have the startup slowness only since a few weeks.

Here a debuglog of a Signal desktop instance running for 2 days. https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.44.0/0dd57d43ef1b1591d2d418607c4f0deeb719ce270f1e0a462d9d6d5b695615a5.gz

You probably need one of a Signal app that was just started up and had been shut down meanwhile for at least a few hours.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.46.0/23faa15b62f978b46b8c18ee23ac111e69654430f835abdaa40fe95695e2a1a0.gz

I am getting added to spam groups and even though I have the group blocked, I was added to it and displayed as added. :/
Sorry about that! We will look into it.

New Version: 7.47.0-beta.2

3 new commits since 7.47.0-beta.1:

  • Fix sequencing of call state updates [1]

  • Update strings [2]

  • 7.47.0-beta.2 [3]

Beta testing for this release has concluded. If you find any further bugs related to this release or earlier releases, please report them on GitHub (read How to Report Bugs for more information on how to do that).

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.48 release.
